title: Deposit/Hancock finshes undefeated regular season
text:
Deposit/Hancock finshes undefeated regular season LWORTHY@PRESSCONNECTS.COM, LYNN WORTHY 12:30 a.m. EDT October 17, 2015 Football logo. CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Deposit/Hancock football team finished off an undefeated regular season with a 34-12 win at home against visiting Delhi in Hancock on Friday night. 
Deposit/Hancock, which will host a first round playoff game next Friday night, finished the regular season 7-0 and captured the Class D Division VI title. That win total is the most in the six years since Deposit and Hancock merged, division championship is the first for Hancock in 10 years and the first for Deposit in eight years. 
D/H senior running back Ronnie Ballard led the way with 157 yards rushing and two touchdowns. Ethan Wormuth (38 yards) also ran for a pair of touchdowns. 
D/H led 16-0 in the first quarter after senior safety Colby Hall stepped in front of a pass in the flat, intercepted it and ran it back 75 yards for the squads second score of the day. 
The Bulldogs couldn’t pull within a touchdown for the rest of the night. D/H took a 28-9 lead into halftime. 
Tioga 43, Oxford 28: The host Tigers clinched their fifth straight Class D Division VII championship behind a three-touchdown performance from senior fullback Adam Zwierlein. All three of his scores came in the first half. 
The Tigers (6-1) held a slim 13-12 lead with two minutes remaining in the first half, but the Tigers used a two-minute drill to tack on another score before the half. Zwierlein, who ran for 82 yards, capped the final drive of the half with a three-year touchdown. 
The Blackhawks remained within a score of the Tigers until the final three minutes when Jess Manuel ran for his second touchdown to give his squad a two-touchdown edge. Manuel ran for 177 yards on 23 carries. 
Owego 27, Norwich 13: Pat Bilbrey and Stavian Canavan led Owego to a victory over host Norwich. Canavan ran for 168 yards with one touchdown, and Bilbrey ran for 49 yards and two rushing touchdowns. 
Bilbrey scored the go-ahead touchdown with 11:54 remaining in the fourth quarter to make the score 20-13. Canavan scored with four minutes left in the game to seal the victory. Norwich’s Cole Rifanburg ran for 81 yards and two rushing touchdowns. 
Greene 35, Whitney Point 0: Junior Zach Orzell finished with 104 rushing yards and two touchdowns on four carries. Both of his rushing touchdowns were 41 yards. Luke Erickson ran 23 times for 210 yards and a touchdown in the victory over visiting Whitney Point. Greene will host Sidney in their regular season finale on Friday at 7. 
Newark Valley 35, Sidney 18: Two late scores by Newark Valley put away the host Sidney to give the Cardinals a Section 4 victory. 
David Crow (10-161) led the Cardinals with two 39-yard scores, the second of the two coming with 4 minutes to go in the half. Sidney Coach Jeff Matthews credited the Newark Valley defense who came up big with two goal-line stands in the game. He also credited Crow stating “he had a couple big runs and was able to make some people miss.” Crow had 119 yards in the first half. 
Darren Smith was able to keep Sidney in the game with a few big throws including two scores to Alex Hoskins and finishing with 250 yards passing. 
Sidney will travel to Green on Friday for a 7 p.m. game. 
Unadilla Valley 28, Unatego 22 (3OT): Unadilla Valley got out to a very quick start as Quarterback Mason Fernette scored three rushing touchdowns in the first quarter to give the Storm an early lead. 
Unatego answered with a 30-yard score from Quarterback Josh Feyerabend, who left the game in the second quarter with an injury and did not return. 
Unatego scored two more times to tie the score at 22, and send the game into overtime. After neither team scored in the first overtime, the Storm came with a big stop on a fourth and goal from the 1-yard line to keep Unatego from scoring in the second overtime. 
Unadilla Valley scored on its next possesion in the third overtime with a pass to Ryan Postma to give the Storm its third win of the season. 
Mary Rakas, Erin Saeger and Nick Cannon contributed to this report Read or Share this story: http://press.sn/1RNEyI3 TOP VIDEOS
